reviews.sentence: Exception Service Nice Hotel. I recently had a 2 night stay at the Dallas Mariot Las Colinas. The service at this hotel is exception. I arrived way too early but no worries. I was given access to the Concierge lounge where I could setup my laptop and get some work done. When my room was ready a front desk person came to bring me my room key and they had already placed my roller board in the room for me. My room was clean and very comfortable. The Concierge is a nice place to hangout in this hotelthis hotel is conveniently located to Hwy 14 and it is also near some great restaurants that are located on MacArthur Blvd. The DFW Airport is only 15 minutes away.

Mariot totally redeemed themselves from my last visit. The service at the hotel was excellent polite friendly attentive staff which is always nice. the hotel was very clean and the water view is a nice touch. My last Mariot stay in Atlanta was terrible this place redeemed the my image of the hotel chain. Only knock is the bathroom is outdated for the price per night but that is a slight knock overall was very pleased with my stay and would come back. And almost forgot wifi should be free at the price point also but its 13 per day fyi.

NOT WORTH FOR YOUR MONEY. We stayed there for a night. While the front desk person was kind enough to give us lake facing room the overall condition of property itself is not very good. It appears that they have not spent a dime after its construction. After sleeping for whole night underneath a fresh looking comforter when in the morning we removed it just to make sure that we are not leaving anything behind we noticed almost 12x4 spot either due to coffee or coke or worst human waste. When we complained at the front desk there were usual reply based on their training to defuse the complaint and to move to next customer. The only response which came was Oh I am so sorry. I will let room service know. Without saying these words essentially she was saying Next guest in line.
I had stay again. it was a beautiful hotel. We were put on a high level facing the water. It was great. The breakfast staff was so nice and accommodating. All in all a wonderful stay.
I love Mariot las colinas as the location us perfect and there is a beautiful lake in the background. The staff is amazing and super respectful. Will be going back for sure.
Went to the Dallas Mariot Las Colinas for a corporate meeting. Parking was very easy the hotel was very clean staff very friendly and professional and the location was beautiful.

Great place to stay on business. I travel to Dallas about 4 times a year for work. This is a great hotel to stay at. Location is perfect close to everything I need to get to and the staff is wonderful. They have a car service on site for trips to the airport which is extremely helpful.

Above and Beyond Expectations. My most recent visit to this Mariot exceeded my expectations thanks to Feby at the front desk. She not only volunteered to sift through my profile to ensure I recieved my points she proactively worked with her management to ensure my billing statements met my needs.

View of the parking lot. The service at the door was awesome tipped him 20 to take the bags upstairs. The person at the service desk Informed me that my room with a balcony and view of the lake was given to someone else. He was apologetic but got a nice standard room with no balcony with a view of the parking lot for the same price. Also ordered room service and a few items were missing. They did try to make up for those errors but already left a bad taste. Will never return.

Mary Kay Career Conference. The hotel is first class. My room was very comfortable. The staff at the front desk were very accommodating and even gave me a late check out when I asked. My only complaint is that they only had one waitress in the bar. And it took her over an hour to take our order even though I asked her to come to our table so that we could place our order. Also she too other clients orders who arrived after we did before she took ours. The hotel was not prepared for the amount of people they were hosting.

Nice location and rooms but skimps on concierge. The location ca n’t be beat if your in Irving. You ’re walking distance to lots of office space restaurants and the Toyota concerts. Hotel is clean and rooms are nicely decorated and recently remodeled. Only one complaint. The concierge is a little skimpy. The breakfast selection is as limited as I ’ve seen at a front line Mariot hotel. Eggs are the only warm items available. You ’l find a better breakfast at a Fairfield Inn than here and it ’s embarrassing when compared to a Sheraton concierge ’s breakfast selection. I guess they ’re trying to drive the regulars down to the restaurant in the morning. Overall it ’s a nice hotel and the location ca n’t be beat.

We arrived to the hotel to find heavy construction and renovations going on. When we checked in we were told we would be without water overnight but would come back on by 6 am. This was it the case as the water did not return until noon the next day. I was told by staff that i should have reviewed their website before booking about the renovations. I actually had which mentioned nothing about renovations. The staff were unwilling to help with any acomadations to help make our stay better. The breakfast was terrible due to lack of water the pool was not clean and the hotel room stayed around 78 degrees the whole time. I absolutely will never stay at a Mariot again.

Horrible experience. I was in town for a conference yesterday and i booked the hotel through my company ’s travel agency. The hotel claimed my reservation did n’t exist and that I had been deleted from a rooming block which I was never part of. They made me wait in the lobby for 30 minutes while they were trying to make up a story to cover themselves. They then tried to tell me my travel company cancelled my booking which upon calling them they did not. Management did not offer to help me find another room in the area and basically left me high and dry with nowhere to stay. Worst customer service experience I ’ve ever experience at any hotel. They can slap a new coat of paint on their hotel but their service still sucks. Stay anywhere else but here.
Nice clean room with good lighting options and lovely bathroom shower. Modern tv that you can sign into and use your video services on but also the normal Mariot annoyance with WiFi charges.
The room and service was very nice but the hotel restaurant had terrible service. The wait staff took forever to get to our table for everything and the hostess was not focused.
We had a reservation and the lady at front desk did not find it. So she gave us a room and when we enter to the room there were another family in there.

Tried vs Omni Mandalay bad idea. More expensive than omni cleaner than Omni. butNo feather free room even though on profile and on reservation room service omitted bacon on club sandwich elevator floor button lights had to be repushed after every elevator stop. No service recovery by Mariot mgmt niceness only part of it. Service and quality equally important.

Nothing is Free. The bill for 3 nights was759 dollars. No free continental breakfast cost 15 per person. no free WiFi cost 13 per day. no microwave vending machine drinks cost 3. grumpy old guy who rather read his e book than nicely respond to resident questions working the front desk on night shift. Obviously our bill would have been higher had we bought any of those extras. The hotel is beautiful but definitely not for middle class on a budget if you ’re going to charge for everything then ALL your employees had better be very nice kind to the residents staying there. We did not use any of the hotel amenities only returned to sleep. so basically we paid 759 dollars for a bed shower 3 nights.

Very elegant hotel now the newest hotel on the block but very well maintained. The staff are welcoming and the hotel was easy to find but still out of the way. Close to restaurants and music bars and other attractions. The hotel was situated on the banks of the river which made for a beautiful night time walk. I diferentiatly recommend this hotel.

Check in employees were amazing and kind. They welcomed us well and made us feel at home. The property is in a great location it ’s very clean. The employees at checkout today were very rude. Not friendly at all and not a single “ goodbye ” “ have a nice day ” or “ come see us again ” from either of the four employees standing at the desk.

Nice hotel horrible restaurant waiter ruined my desire to return to this site. This is a nice hotel great view nice front desk staff nice bar staff clean except for the crooked poorly installed shower door no complaints on the room. HOWEVER. the breakfast waiter named Hector we had for our free with room breakfast gratuity included vouchers was extremely rude. I asked him if we needed to sign a check for our breakfast voucher and he said no only if we wanted it for a tip. When I told him that our voucher states gratuity included on the back he replied no it does not then I asked him to read the back and he said whatever you say. Hey we were asking if the service is nice we gladly leave extra tip but his attitude changed and his disregard for us was more than obvious. Even a manager came to bring us things when he saw us waiting so long. So although we traveled there for work and we thought the place would be great for our required meetings we did not like that a waiter would refuse to be courteous not attend us and outright ask if we wanted our check to be able to leave a tip. Obviously rude because whether or not he understood the words gratuity included means tip included or not his attitude has turned all of our party off to returning to this site. And as Mariot Titanium Elite status members what a shame Mariot really. Educate your staff on decorum and etiquette when business travelers are using your breakfast included rates to save time and expenses.

Mostly nice but no place to get work done. Most things about this hotel are great but there was one very displeasing thing the desk area. The desk chair in the room was a very cheap poorly designed chair for any real work. It was literally painful to sit on an upholstered chair with almost no cushioning it felt like sitting on a board not adjustable in any way and forced an uncomfortable posture. Why a hotel this expensive can not furnish a proper desk chair is inexplicable. Add to that there was not enough light in the room.
